page.title: 17HOUSING IN PAISLEY
page.content: Housing in the area is extremely varied and although some of it is now over 100 years old, almost all of the housing is in a good state of repair. The dominant housing types are:- {-Victorian tenements}built for the workers in the nearby mills. The poorest tenements have been demolished allowing road improvements and increa- sed office space, the remainder being modernised. The eastern edge of the town is made up of inter-war owner-occupied housing close to green areas. It is unusual for the eastern side of a town to have such a large are of low-density housing and this has repercussions on services and amenities. Small areas of new housing, private and council, have been built where a small site has changed its land-use.
